class src.core.parameter.Parameter(name, value=None, valid_values=None, info=None, visible=False)[source]¶

Bases: dict

__init__(name, value=None, valid_values=None, info=None, visible=False)[source]¶

Parameter(name, value, valid_values, info) Parameter(name, value, valid_values) Parameter(name, value) Parameter({name: value})

Future updates: Parameter({name1: value1, name2: value2}) Parameter([p1, p2]), where p1 and p2 are parameter objects

Parameters:
  • name – name of parameter
  • value – value of parameter can be any basic type or a list
  • valid_values – defines which values are accepted for value can be a type or a list if not provided => type(value)
  • info – description of parameter, if not provided => empty string
  • visible – boolean if true always show parameter if false hide it
__module__ = 'src.core.parameter'¶
__setitem__(key, value)[source]¶

overwrites the standard dictionary and checks if value is valid :param key: dictionary key :param value: dictionary value

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

info¶

Returns: a text describing the paramter

static is_valid(value, valid_values)[source]¶

check is the value is valid :param value: value to be tested :param valid_values: allowed valid values (type or list of values)

Returns:

update(*args)[source]¶

updates the values of the parameter, just as a regular dictionary

valid_values¶

Returns: valid value of the paramerer (a type like int, float or a list)

visible¶

Returns: if parameter should be shown (False) or hidden (True) in the GUI
